content.text:
Provide one single-word clue that relates to some of your team's words from the list below. You can choose to how many and to which words your clue relates to.
The goal is to have your partner guess all of your team's words based on the clues you give them, before the other team has uncovered all of theirs. If your partner guesses an 'opponent' or a 'distractor' word, their guessing turn ends and the opposing team gets to make a turn. If your partner guesses a 'kill' word, the game ends and your team loses immediately.
The more words your clue relates to, the quicker you can win the game, but the harder the associations may be to guess for your partner, so choose your clue word wisely. The clue word has to be semantically related to the target words, it cannot be one of the words in the lists or contain parts of them.

Always give your single-word clue and your comma-separated list of related target words in the following format and make your answers as short as possible, never include any other text than is required in this form:

CLUE: <WORD>
TARGETS: <TARGETS>

Your team words are: scotch, vodka, smallpox, soccer, measles, malaria, skiing, whiskey, liquor.
Your opponent's team words are: parsley, goldfish, cauliflower, lettuce, cabbage, catfish, celery, thyme.
Distractor words are: daughter, brass, titanium, niece, platinum, steel, grandparent.
The kill words are: mosque.

- "Alcohol" - connects scotch, vodka, whiskey, liquor

- "Virus" (though malaria is caused by a parasite, not a virus)

- "Epidemic" - connects smallpox, measles, malaria

For sports:

- "Winter" might suggest skiing, but not soccer

The best approach is to find a clue that can connect as many words as possible while being clear enough for my partner to guess.

The alcoholic beverages group seems to be the largest with 4 related words. A clue like "Alcohol" or "Spirits" would be effective.

If I want to try connecting more words across groups, I could think of more abstract connections.

"Shots" could potentially connect both alcoholic beverages (shot of liquor) and diseases (vaccine shots for smallpox, measles), but it might be too stretchy.

content.thinking:
I need to select words that are most closely associated with "epidemic".

An epidemic is a widespread occurrence of an infectious disease in a community at a particular time. Looking at the list, I need to identify words related to diseases or conditions that could become epidemic.

From the list, these words stand out as potentially related to "epidemic":
- malaria - an infectious disease spread by mosquitoes
- measles - a highly contagious infectious disease
- smallpox - a highly contagious infectious disease that has been eradicated through vaccination

These three are all infectious diseases that have caused epidemics throughout history, making them strongly associated with the word "epidemic".

None of the other words are closely related to epidemics:
- thyme, cabbage, celery, parsley, lettuce, cauliflower - these are plants/vegetables
- soccer, skiing - these are sports
- mosque - a place of worship
- brass, steel, platinum, titanium - these are metals
- grandparent, niece, daughter - these are family relations
- goldfish - a pet/animal

So my guess will be the three disease names: malaria, measles, and smallpox.

content.text: GUESS: malaria, measles, smallpox
